com.clarionmedia.infinitum.internal

Class DateFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.internal.DateFormatter

  • public class DateFormatter
extends java.lang.Object

    This class contains methods for formatting Date objects into Strings and vice versa.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 02/13/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat HTTP_EXPIRES_FORMAT
      SimpleDateFormat containing the date pattern used by the HTTP Expires header.
      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat ISO_8601_FORMAT
      SimpleDateFormat containing the date pattern for the ISO 8601 standard.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getDateAsISO8601String(java.util.Date date)
      Returns the String representation of the given Date.
      static java.util.Date parseHttpExpiresStringAsDate(java.lang.String input)
      Parses the given String, formatted as an HTTP Expires date, as a Date instance or null if it could not be parsed.
      static java.util.Date parseStringAsDate(java.lang.String input)
      Parses the given String as a Date instance or null if it could not be parsed.

      • getDateAsISO8601String

        public static java.lang.String getDateAsISO8601String(java.util.Date date)
        Returns the String representation of the given Date.
        Parameters:
        date - the Date instance to retrieve the String for
        Returns:
        String for the specified Date

      • parseStringAsDate

        public static java.util.Date parseStringAsDate(java.lang.String input)
        Parses the given String as a Date instance or null if it could not be parsed. Date String should be in ISO-8601 format.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to parse as a Date
        Returns:
        Date instance of String

      • parseHttpExpiresStringAsDate

        public static java.util.Date parseHttpExpiresStringAsDate(java.lang.String input)
        Parses the given String, formatted as an HTTP Expires date, as a Date instance or null if it could not be parsed.
        Parameters:
        input -
        Returns:
